results.title: Vanishing Africa
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of soil conservation in Africa. Bushfires and certain methods of farming have removed much of the vegetation of the land, leaving the fertile topsoil exposed to the action of wind and water. The only way to combat erosion is to teach Africans the needs and make-up of the soil and how to preserve its fertility. Work is also being done in the reclaiming of eroded land.

results.title: Vandalism
results.brief_description: Playing dangerous practical jokes, stealing from shops, letting down car tyres, stealing a car, running from police, all for a bit of fun. This film examines how this all leads to a criminal record and juvenile delinquency.

results.title: Van Gogh [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Maurice Pialat, Daniel Toscan du Plantier, Sylvie Danton, Canal+, Erato FIlms, Films A2 and Films du Livradois
results.brief_description: This film departs from the conventions of the artist’s biopic more radically than the Van Gogh films ‘Lust for Life’ (1956) or ‘Vincent and Theo’ (1990). Pialat makes no attempt to ‘explain’ Van Gogh’s creative genius or illuminate the dark side of his psyche. Rather he uses an accumulation of naturalistic detail to present an emotionally restrained account of the last three months of Vincent’s life. He is shown to be irrationally resentful of Theo’s failure to sell his paintings and his moods swing erratically between introspection and frustrated anger. Dutrone’s inwardness contrasts with Douglas’s expressionism (in Lust for Life). Pialat introduces a fictional relationship between Vincent and Dr. Gachet’s daughter in order to show Vincent ‘as a man like any other.’ Compared to the portrayal in ‘Vincent and Theo’ Gachet is shown in a positive light. Cast: Jacques Dutronc, Alexandra London, Gerard Sety, Bernard le Coq. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Van Eyck: father of Flemish painting
results.creator_credit: Jean Cleinge, Monique Moinet, Paul Louyet, International Film Bureau and Resobel
results.brief_description: Jan Van Eyck, a rebel in his own time, strove to free painting from the conventions and restrictions of manuscript illumination of the early 15th century. He developed a personal style, and on it the entire Flemish School of painting was built. The film aptly illustrates his mastery and the many close-ups reveal the precision and skill of the artist. Works studied in the film include: Giovanni Arnolfini and his Bride, the altarpiece in Ghent, focusing on The Adoration of the Lamb and the Madonna with Chancellor Rolin. The camera explores the major subjects of other paintings as well as the smallest background detail. Just as many of Van Eyck’s paintings are a tribute to the glory of God, this film is a monument to the marvels of his art. Music by Andre Colson.

results.title: Vampire Princess Miyu. Eps 3-4
results.creator_credit: Toshihiro Hirano, Kasushi Nomura, Toru Miura and Manga Entertainment
results.brief_description: Continues the story of the childlike vampire, Miyu, guardian of the portal between the human world and that of the Shinma (demon gods). In Fragile Armour’, Miyu pleads with the medium Himiko to help release her mysterious protector-servant Larva from the demon gods who have trapped him between the worlds. Himiko agrees to assist, but only in exchange for information about the elusive vampire’s past.Frozen Time’ sees Himiko return to her childhood home in Kamakura in search of a mysterious house she believed was once there. As she delves deeper into her memories, she discovers the startling link between her fate and that of Miyu. A haunting saga of “beauty, blood and sorrow” from Toshihiro Hirano.

results.title: Vampire princess Miyu. 5. Dark love [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Toshihiro Hirano, Joel Baral and Miyu Production Committee
results.brief_description: Dark love continues the lonely journey of the vampire guardian Miyu and her eternal companion, Larva, with the five stories presented in this compilation focusing on the theme of forbidden love. In “The moray boat”, Miyu encounters problems when she comes to vanquish the shinma Ayu, who has fallen in love with a failed author. In “City of illusion”, Miyu and Reiha sense the evil of a shinma at work when buildings mysteriously begin to dissolve into piles of sand. In “Love of the dolls”, a gifted dollmaker gets more than she bargained for when a fit of jealousy animates her most precious creation. In “Butterfly enchantment”, Miyu is drawn into the strange life of Ruri Sone, and the dark secret that haunts her soul. In “Flag of shinma”, Miyu makes an enemy of Reiha forever when she wanders into an alternate world and intervenes in a battle to save a young girl from becoming the bride of three shinma brothers. Based on the shoujo manga by Kakinouchi Narumi.

results.title: Vampire princess Miyu 4 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Toshihiro Hirano, Joel Baral and Miyu Production Committee
results.brief_description: Shinma are supernatural beings that devour the hearts of men and lead them to ruin. Long ago they were sealed in the Dark World. However, there are stray Shinma that live secretly in the human world. They lurk in the division between night and day. The Guardian who sends the stray Shinma back to the Dark World is the beautiful vampire, Miyu. No-one knows her true face. The childlike vampire and her faithful demon servant Larva continue to obliterate rampant Shinma from the human realm in episodes 12 to 16 of the Vampire Princess Miyu television series. Diverging slightly from the conventions set in the original animated video, the stories on this compilation explore the recurrent themes of karmic fate and the price of immortality although they retain Kenji Kawai’s ambient music and the dark, gothic feel, synonymous with this series. In “Garden of the crying reeds,” a lonely young man searching for his lost cat gets more than he bargained for when he agrees to do a favour for a stunning woman living amidst the ruins of a Western style mansion. In “Light of the sea (part one),” Miyu becomes distressed when Larva disappears after being charmed away from her side by an unknown force, with the only clues to his whereabouts linked to a pair of local shinma who have fallen in love. Her quest to find her protector-servant is both helped and hindered by the sudden appearance of fellow guardian and sworn enemy, Reiha. In “Light of the sea (part two),” the first meeting between Larva and Miyu is revealed in flashback, setting the scene for the inevitable showdown to follow. In “Dream of the mermaid,” a young man believes he has found a soul mate when he encounters an unhappy mermaid at the city aquarium, unwilling to believe that she is a shinma. In “Woman priest,” Yui-Li, a Chinese priestess and do-shi martial arts expert arrives in Japan, determined to hunt down and vanquish the shinma who destroyed those she loved.

results.title: Vampire Princess Miyu
results.creator_credit: Eri Tsukamoto, Toshihiro Hirano, Toru Miura, Yasushi Nomura and Manga Entertainment
results.brief_description: Eerie exploits of a childlike vampire, Princess Miyu, who travels between two worlds - the human realm and and a strange underworld of demon gods and lost souls. Two chapters of her story are included in this videocassette. In ‘Capital of mystery’ the search is on to find the evil force which is killing the women of Kyoto. Princess Miyu in the second episode ‘Puppet festival’ must defeat the evil vampire Ranka whose kiss turns mortals into puppets.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eri Tsukamoto, Toshihiro Hirano, Toru Miura, Yasushi Nomura and Manga Entertainment

results.title: Vampire myths
results.brief_description: This documentary examines the contemporary fascination with vampirism and vampire culture. Bram Stoker’s famous novel, Dracula, has spawned a multitude of fictions since it’s debut in 1897. This documentary examines the contemporary fascination with this literary vision of vampirism, and focuses on the subculture that has evolved around it, questioning whether it reflects a desire for immortality, or if it is simply another way of making contact with the darker side of humanity. In an effort to understand the appeal of this movement, the documentary delves into the history of Vlad Tsepes (Dracul), the 15th century warrior-prince whom Stoker based the character of Dracula upon. To explore this phenomenon further, there are interviews with Nicholas Strathloch, who claims to come from a long line of vampires and drinks human blood, Kathy and Dale McKinley, who claim to be able to channel the spirit of Vlad Tsepes, and Catrina Coffin, who lives like a vampire. Opinions are also sought from a diverse array of people including a theologian, a psychiatrist, an author, a member of the Transylvanian Society of Dracula, a hypnotist and a psychic.

results.title: Value analysis
results.creator_credit: Sam Napier-Bell, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: Value analysis is a disciplined approach to cost reduction by the systematic examination and appraisal of the product and its components. Introduced in an engineering company, it emphasises the importance of team approach and describes in detail the various stages of a value analysis investigation. Some convincing examples of reduction in costs through value analysis.
